titleStmt.title: Sameul G. Suddarth, Receipt to Hodges, Hughes & Co.
CWG13679

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 11; Bundles of AG & QMG Expenditures 1864-65; Bundle 3

body.p:
NO. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To Hodges Hughes & Co., Dr

row.cell: For the following printing &c. done for Adjutant Generals office viz,
for printing 6 quires Circular in relation to Expatriated Enrolled Militia @ 50 cts
For printing 9 quires General orders No 2. 1 page note paper
For publishing Genl. Orders no 2 in Commonwealth 3 sqrs Daily 1 week
For printing 700 Large Envelopes -- 3 Tokens Press work @ 75
For printing 7 quires Blanks "Returns of Regts. Ky vols -- their condition &c" two forms on both sides sheet -- @ $2
For printing 11 quires Headings for "Special orders" @ 50 cts
For printing 20 quires Letter Heads @ 50 cts
For printing 84 quires Volunteer Enlistments two forms on both side,s @ $1

p.note:
Approved By order of the Governor
John Boyle
Adjt. Gen. of Ky.

body.p: I certify that the above account is correct and just, and that the services were rendered as stated, and were necessary for the public service.

John Boyle
Adjt Gen of Ky.
Quarter-Master.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 21st of March, 1864, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter=Master General of the State of Kentucky, One hundred and thirty dollars and -- cents, in full of the above account.
(DUPLICATE.)

137
No 22.
No. 24 Abstract. N
Hodges Hughes & Co
Dollars 130.00/100
Paid March 21st, 1864
